intro: Micropiper tenellum, commonly known as the slender pipevine, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family, characterized by its unique, pipe-shaped flowers that resemble small pipes. The plant has a climbing habit and produces small, fragrant blossoms that are often overlooked due to their modest size. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a waxy texture, while its stems are thin and vine-like. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Micropiper tenellum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
